ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Functions and datasets to support Smilde, Marini, Westerhuis and Liland (2025, ISBN: 978-1-394-21121-0) "Analysis of Variance for High-Dimensional Data - Applications in Life, Food and Chemical Sciences". This implements and imports a  collection of methods for HD-ANOVA data analysis with common interfaces, result- and plotting functions, multiple real data sets and four vignettes covering a range different applications.

Functions and datasets to support Smilde, Marini, Westerhuis and Liland (2025, ISBN: 978-1-394-21121-0) "Analysis of Variance for High-Dimensional Data - Applications in Life, Food and Chemical Sciences". This implements and imports a  collection of methods for HD-ANOVA data analysis with common interfaces, result- and plotting functions, multiple real data sets and four vignettes covering a range different applications.

name: r-hdanova
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.8.4" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-hdanova
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/HDANOVA_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/HDANOVA/HDANOVA_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 5412995d60bd301eb40356728bf077acad57fb3217020b26981645e613fdf555

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-rspectra
    - r-car
    - r-lme4
    - r-mixlm >=1.4.3
    - r-pls
    - r-pracma
    - r-progress
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-rspectra
    - r-car
    - r-lme4
    - r-mixlm >=1.4.3
    - r-pls
    - r-pracma
    - r-progress

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('HDANOVA')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('HDANOVA')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/khliland/HDANOVA/
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: 'Functions and datasets to support Smilde, Marini, Westerhuis and Liland (2025, ISBN: 978-1-394-21121-0) "Analysis of Variance for High-Dimensional Data - Applications in Life, Food and Chemical Sciences". This implements and imports a  collection of methods for HD-ANOVA data analysis with common interfaces, result-
    and plotting functions, multiple real data sets and four vignettes covering a range different applications.'
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
